question: What is the tallest building in the world as of 2024?
response_a: The Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world, standing at 828 meters (2,717 feet). It was completed in 2010 and has held the record since then.
response_b:
The Burj Khalifa in Dubai, UAE is the tallest building in the world at 828 meters [1]. It surpassed Taipei 101 when completed in 2010. The Jeddah Tower in Saudi Arabia is under construction and planned to exceed 1,000 meters when completed [2].

Sources:
[1] https://www.burjkhalifa.ae
[2] https://www.jeddahtower.com

question: How does CRISPR gene editing work?
response_a: CRISPR uses a guide RNA to direct the Cas9 enzyme to a specific location in DNA. The enzyme cuts both strands, and the cell's repair mechanisms either disable the gene or allow insertion of new sequences.
response_b: CRISPR-Cas9 is a gene editing tool adapted from bacterial immune systems. A guide RNA (gRNA) complementary to the target sequence directs Cas9 to make a double-strand break. This triggers either non-homologous end joining (NHEJ), causing insertions/deletions, or homology-directed repair (HDR) for precise edits when a template is provided.
